noun.description: In defensive play, a system of signals and discards by which a player indicates a desire for his or her partner to lead a particular suit. Usually attributive, frequently in "McKenney convention".

origin: 1930s. From the name of William E. McKenney, U.S. player of bridge, who popularized the system (devised by the American player Hy Lavinthal in 1934) in his daily newspaper column.
